乘.definition: (archaic) four horse military chariot; (archaic) four; generic term for history books

乘人不備.definition: to take advantage of sb in an unguarded moment (idiom); to take sb by surprise

乘人之危.definition: to take advantage of sb's precarious position

乘冪.definition: (math.) to exponentiate; to raise (a number) to a power; exponentiation; power

乘務.definition: service (on a train, a plane etc)

乘務員.definition: attendant on an airplane, train, boat etc

乘勝.definition: to follow up a victory; to pursue retreating enemy

乘勝追擊.definition: to follow up a victory and press home the attack; to pursue retreating enemy

乘勢.definition: to seize the opportunity; to strike while the iron is hot

乘堅策肥.definition: to live in luxury; lit. to ride a solid carriage pulled by fat horses

乘搭.definition: to ride as a passenger (in a car, boat, plane etc)

乘方.definition: (math.) to exponentiate; to raise (a number) to a power; exponentiation; power

乘機.definition: to take the opportunity; to take a plane

乘涼.definition: to cool off in the shade

乘火打劫.definition: to take advantage of sb's misfortune; to loot

乘興.definition: while in high spirits; feeling upbeat; on an impulse

乘船.definition: to embark; to travel by ship; to ferry

乘虛而入.definition: to enter by exploiting a weak spot (idiom); to take advantage of a lapse

乘車.definition: to ride (in a car or carriage); to drive; to motor

乘隙.definition: to seize an opportunity; to exploit (a loophole)

乘風.definition: to ride the wind; to use a fair wind; to take an opportunity

乘風破浪.definition: to brave the wind and the billows (idiom); to have high ambitions

乘鶴.definition: to fly on a crane; to die

乘龍.definition: to ride the dragon; to die (of emperors and kings)
